title: تعزيز فرص الشغل محور مباحثات مغربية صينية رفيعة المستوى
summary: استقبل عزيز أخنوش، رئيس الحكومة، اليوم الإثنين الرباط، وفدا من كبار المسؤولين والفاعلين الاقتصاديين بمقاطعة آنهوي الصينية، بقيادة أمين الحزب الشيوعي الصيني بهذه المقاطعة، ليانغ يانشون، حيث تم بحث سبل تطوير الشراكة الاقتصادية المتميزة بين المغرب والصين، تنفيذا لتوجيهات قائدي البلدين، الملك محمد السا…
body: استقبل عزيز أخنوش، رئيس الحكومة، اليوم الإثنين الرباط، وفدا من كبار المسؤولين والفاعلين الاقتصاديين بمقاطعة آنهوي الصينية، بقيادة أمين الحزب الشيوعي الصيني بهذه المقاطعة، ليانغ يانشون، حيث تم بحث سبل تطوير الشراكة الاقتصادية المتميزة بين المغرب والصين، تنفيذا لتوجيهات قائدي البلدين، الملك محمد السادس، ورئيس جمهورية الصين أكمل القراءة » المقالة تعزيز فرص الشغل محور مباحثات مغربية صينية رفيعة المستوى fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: Astronomers spot the most powerful and distant 'odd radio circle' ever seen
summary: With help from citizen scientists, astronomers have found the most powerful and distant "odd radio circle" ever detected.

title: A massive weak spot in Earth's magnetic field is growing, scientists discover
summary: The South Atlantic Anomaly, a huge weak spot in the geomagnetic field off South America, has expanded and sprouted a lobe in the direction of Africa over the past decade.

title: Satellites Are Leaking the World’s Secrets: Calls, Texts, Military and Corporate Data
summary: With just $800 in basic equipment, researchers found a stunning variety of data—including thousands of T-Mobile users’ calls and texts and even US military communications—sent by satellites unencrypted.

title: Link between Cascadia and San Andreas Fault earthquakes discovered 30 years after lost vessel stumbled across key data
summary: Geological records hint that earthquakes at the Cascadia subduction zone might trigger the San Andreas Fault.

title: 'Planet Y' theory hints at hidden Earth-size world lurking in the solar system — and it could be much closer to us than 'Planet Nine'
summary: A new study has proposed the existence of Planet Y, an alternative Planet Nine candidate that is smaller and closer to Earth than the hypothetical Planet X, which astronomers have been hunting for almost a decade. However, the evidence for this newly theorized world is "not definitive."

title: Hidden 'doomed' star revealed by James Webb Space Telescope could solve decades-old mystery
summary: Researchers have identified a massive red supergiant on the brink of supernova in images from the James Webb Space Telescope, shedding light on a decades-old star mystery.

title: An 'ice tsunami' in 2024 ripped through the Yukon with such force it tore up trees and the riverbed
summary: Chunks of river ice tore down trees after a landslide caused a tsunami in the Yukon in December.

title: $100,000 quadrillion asteroid Psyche may be the product of metal volcanoes, study hints
summary: The metal-coated asteroid Psyche may have had eruptions of molten iron and nickel on its surface. This situation was more likely if the space rock is made of the same chemicals as metal-rich meteorites, a new study suggests.

title: How to Make STEM Funny—and Go Viral Doing It
summary: If you stayed awake in science class as a kid, the payoff comes when you get a good laugh out of Freya McGhee’s jokes.

title: Scientists 'reawaken' ancient microbes from permafrost — and discover they start churning out CO2 soon after
summary: Researchers incubated permafrost samples from Alaska at different temperatures and found that microbes from the last ice age can reactivate and resume breaking down carbon.

title: What if Christopher Columbus had never reached the Americas?
summary: How would history have unfolded if Christopher Columbus had never reached the New World?

title: More Evidence Emerges That One of Saturn’s Moons Could Harbor Life
summary: Previously undetected organic compounds have been found in ice ejected into space from Enceladus, making the satellite a prime candidate for further research.

title: A New Algorithm Makes It Faster to Find the Shortest Paths
summary: A canonical problem in computer science is to find the shortest route to every point in a network. A new approach beats the classic algorithm taught in textbooks.

title: Physicists capture rare illusion of an object moving at 99.9% the speed of light
summary: For the first time, physicists have simulated what objects moving near the speed of light would look like — an optical illusion called the Terrell-Penrose effect.

title: Hubble went supernova hunting — and found something unexpected: Space photo of the week
summary: The Hubble Space Telescope reveals how color filters tease out the life cycles of stars in spiral galaxy NGC 6000 — while a surprise asteroid streaks through the frame.

title: Which planets are the youngest and oldest in our solar system?
summary: There are a couple of ways that scientists can date planets, so which planets formed first in our solar system?

title: Hidden, supercharged 'thermostat' may cause Earth to overcorrect for climate change
summary: Rising levels of CO2 in the atmosphere may trigger a series of geological and biological processes that could ensure the next ice age arrives on time instead of being delayed, researchers say.

title: Australia’s March Toward 100 Percent Clean Energy
summary: The country’s grid operator says shifting from coal to clean power is not only possible but inevitable. The work there could provide a road map for other countries.

title: Up to 20,000 coins from Early Middle Ages discovered by man digging for worms near Stockholm
summary: A man digging for worms at his summer house in Sweden has unearthed a stupendous treasure: a silver hoard of up to 20,000 coins from the Early Middle Ages.

title: Einstein's relativity could rewrite a major rule about what types of planets are habitable
summary: Planets that orbit white dwarf stars should be too hot to host alien life, theories suggest. But a new study accounting for Einstein's general relativity may rewrite that rule.

title: China issues new pledge to cut greenhouse gas emissions — is it now a global leader in climate action?
summary: China has committed to slash its greenhouse gas emissions by 7% to 10% by 2035 — but is this going to cut it? Tell us what you think.

title: Ancient Roman tombstone found beneath undergrowth in New Orleans yard
summary: A New Orleans couple doing yard work behind their house unexpectedly found a Roman headstone of a solider who died 1,900 years ago.

title: 200-foot scorpion effigy mound in Mexico may align with the solstices
summary: A 205-foot-long, scorpion-shaped mound in Mexico likely helped Mesoamericans mark the summer and winter solstices, a new study finds.

title: James Webb telescope may have spotted controversial 'dark stars' in the far universe
summary: Using observations from the James Webb Space Telescope, astrophysicists have spotted what they say is compelling evidence of a new type of cosmic object called a 'dark star.'

title: Satellites detected strange gravity signal coming from deep within Earth almost 20 years ago, study reveals
summary: Researchers have discovered there was an anomaly in Earth's gravitational field between 2006 and 2008, potentially caused by a mineral shift deep within Earth's mantle. GRACE satellites detected a strange gravity signal at the time.

title: Psychedelic beer may have helped pre-Inca empire in Peru schmooze elite outsiders and consolidate power
summary: The Wari used beer mixed with psychedelics to help build an empire in Peru around 1,200 years ago, a new study suggests.

title: العناني أول مصري وعربي يتولى رئاسة اليونسكو.. والسيسي يهنئه
summary: ‏‎انتخب المجلس التنفيذي لمنظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة (اليونسكو) بأغلبية ساحقة خالد العناني مرشح مصر لمنصب مدير عام المنظمة، وذلك خلال الانتخابات التي جرت الإثنين، حسبما أفاد المتحدث باسم الخارجية المصرية.

title: من المرشح المصري الأوفر حظا لقيادة اليونسكو؟
summary: يجرى الإثنين تصويت حاسم للمجلس التنفيذي لليونسكو، منظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة، بهدف اختيار المدير العام المقبل، في خطوة تكتسب أهمية فائقة، إذ سيتولى الفائز قيادة المنظمة لـ4 سنوات وسط اتهامها بأنها "مسيسة"، وفي ظل الارتباك الذي أحدثه إعلان الولايات المتحدة خروجها منها.

title: إغلاق قناة "ناصر".. وأسرة عبد الناصر تتحرك لإنقاذ الأرشيف
summary: أقدمت منصة "يوتيوب" على إغلاق قناة "Nasser TV (ناصر تي في)" التي كانت تبث تسجيلات نادرة للرئيس المصري الراحل جمال عبد الناصر، في خطوة أثارت تفاعلًا واسعًا خلال الساعات الماضية، وسط سعي أسرته لاستعادتها أو البحث عن بدائل لنشر باقي تسجيلاته النادرة.

title: أوروبا تبحث تحديث قواعد ملفات الارتباط لتسهيل التصفح
summary: تسعى المفوضية الأوروبية إلى جعل تصفح الإنترنت أكثر سهولة، عبر تخفيف قواعد الخصوصية، وإيجاد طريقة جديدة لإدارة ملفات الارتباط (الكوكيز).
